problem-solving-process-story.text: You Have All the Pieces. You've learned to ask deep questions. You've learned to see and analyze data. You've learned to build real things. Now it's time to put it all together and solve a real problem.
Start with Questions. Every solution starts with understanding. Go six levels deep to truly understand the problem. Don't jump to solutions—understand the root causes first.
Gather Data. Collect information about your problem. What resources exist? What do people say? What specific data would help? Organize what you find and look for patterns.
Find Insights. Patterns in your data reveal opportunities. What's missing? What could be better? Your insights guide what to build. Data without insight is just noise.
Build the Solution. Now you build! Use Cursor and AI to create something that addresses the problem. Iterate—build a first version, test it, then improve. Real solutions evolve.

capstone-journey-story.text: Choose Your Problem. Pick one problem to solve. It should be real—something you've actually observed. Specific—not too broad. And solvable—something you can actually address with a tool or resource.
Deep Understanding. Use ChatGPT to go six levels deep. Keep asking why about each answer. Document all six levels. This helps you build a better solution because you truly understand the problem.
Gather Your Data. What resources or solutions already exist? What do people say about this problem? What specific data would help—locations, prices, reviews? Organize everything you find.
Build with AI. Use Cursor to build your solution. Describe what you want, explain the problem, list the features. Make it professional and easy to use. Then iterate—improve based on what works.

Deploy and Test. Put your solution on GitHub Pages so it's live on the internet. Share it with two or three people who might use it. Get their feedback, then make improvements. Real solutions need real users.

portfolio-celebration-story.text: Your Portfolio. Your portfolio showcases everything you've learned. It includes work from each week plus your capstone project. This is proof that you can solve real problems.

Present Your Work. You'll present your capstone to the group. Cover the problem, your research, the data you gathered, demo your solution, and share what you learned. Keep it short—three to five minutes.
Show, Don't Tell. Demo your actual project. Let them see it work. Quality over quantity. Be proud—you built something real. That's something most people never do.
You're a Builder Now. Congratulations! You've completed the academy. You're not just a consumer of technology anymore. You're a builder. You're a problem solver. The world needs more people like you.

Keep Going. This is just the beginning. Keep building, stay curious, help others, and level up. The best time to start solving problems was yesterday. The second best time is right now. You have the skills—now go use them!
